Sequence Information.Peptide Name: P3 (hemoglobin residues 97-114; Leu-rich; natural AMPs; cattle; mammals, animals; UCLL1a)

Literature Information.Literature: APD analysis reveals that the sequence of this peptide shows 84.2% similarity tobovine hemoglobin 97-114. This peptide corresponds to residues 96-113, which may be a variant.Activity: Active against E. coli ATCC 25922 or clinical strain (MIC 12.5 ug/ml), S. aureus ATCC 29213 or clinical strain (MIC 12.5-25 ug/ml), P. aeruginosa clinical strain (MIC 25 ug/ml), and C. albicans ATCC 90029 or cinical strain (MIC 50 ug/ml). Updated 7/2021; merged 5/2023
Literature Information.Author: Hu J, Xu M, Hang B, Wang L, Wang Q, Chen J, Song T, Fu D, Wang Z, Wang S. 2011
Literature Information.Reference: World Journal of Microbiology and Biotechnology 2011; 27:767-771.
Literature Information.Title: Isolation and characterization of an antimicrobial peptide from bovine hemoglobin alpha-subunit
